intro: Cynoglossum omphaloides, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer, typically from July to September. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Cynoglossum omphaloides is also known for its medicinal properties, historically used in herbal remedies.
